{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anti-D prophylaxis is given to Rh-negative women to prevent RhD alloimmunization. It is administered in situations where there is a risk of feto-maternal hemorrhage, which can lead to sensitization. This includes after amniocentesis, manual removal of placenta, and intra-uterine transfusion. However, MTP at 63 days does not require Anti D prophylaxis as the risk of sensitization is very low.", "answer_choice": "A"}
